content:
It seems as if David Mumford is speaking at this conference I kinda plan to attend:

  • Mathematics of Collective Intelligence, Institute of Pure and Applied Mathematics, UCLA, February 15-19.
Some people are listed as giving virtual talks, but he's listed as giving a real talk. (The opposite of virtual.)

I don't know if I really believe that. But anyway, his talk title is "Grammars, feedback, high dimensional representation: clues to the magical algorithm", and since I've never met him, his presence might be enough to make me overcome my fear of COVID and go there.
